noun.description: A sharp twist or curve in something that is otherwise straight.
A stiffness in the neck, back, etc.; crick.
examples: it takes the kinks out of stiff necks

verb.description: Form or cause to form a sharp twist or curve.
examples: the river kinks violently in a right angle
when the spine gets kinked, the muscles react with pain

origin: Late 17th century: from Middle Low German kinke, probably from Dutch kinken to kink.
